alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 12:52PM CDT until September 04 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 245 PM CDT. * At 1252 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Slidell, Pearl River, Lacombe and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 272. Interstate 12 between mile markers 76 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
